comment: This is a page from a classical Chinese dictionary or lexicographical text, likely a version of the *Shuowen Jiezi* (说文解字) or a similar work. The layout includes small seal script characters on the left, followed by explanations in regular script (楷书) to the right. Each entry provides the character, its phonetic pronunciation (using *fanqie* method), etymology, and definitions. The central column states '文二百四十八 重三十一', meaning '248 original characters, 31 repeated (or derived) characters'. The vertical text along the left margin indicates the section ('大廿二' = 'Great Section 22') and possibly the publisher or editor ('袁和').
